I like Japanese culture and food. I even took JLPT at N one level in Tokyo. My reading far outshines my listening skills the marks I lost in listening were offset by those I gained in reading. My friend Jason too took the test. He's a little weak in listening but strong in reading so the marks he gained in the reading part offset those he lost in the listening section. After the tests we spent money on clothes and shoes like it was going out of fashion. We entered a casino and gambled like it was going out of fashion. If you enjoy being in Japan you might spend money on food and cosmetic products like its going iut of fashion. If you go to the casino you might gamble like it's going out of fashion like we did. My friend Tomio soaks up new words and grammar patterns very quickly. In the classes he soaks up everything the teacher says. His vocabulary is fairly large whereas his cousin has a very limited vocabulary. He tries to learn eleven new vocabulary items a day to expand his vocabulary. He has a vocabulary of around twenty thousand words which is pretty impressive. His cousin's husband has an active vocabulary of about eight thousand eight hundred words. Of course your passive vocabulary is much wider than your active vocabulary. What's the best way of learning new vocabulary ? What's the most ideal way of enriching your vocabulary ? For Jason, it is via reading a japanese novel over and over again until you can remember every part of the story. For others, it is through creating sentences  with new words in them and pronouncing them. Originally  yesterday I had lunch in an Italian restaurant but I realised I didn't like the menu. As I was leaving a waitress came up to me so I said "Thank you but I've changed my mind" A burly guy and a svelte girl also didn't like the menu so the guy said "Thank you. We're in the mood for a different cuisine today. We'll be back another time. Thank you for your hospitality. I work in Hotel JAP Tokyo. My cousin came to stay for a few nights as company for me while my colleagues are away. (When I'm in a hotel room I usually have the television on until I go to bed) My friend Rika has got a commission for a sculpture, a sketch, an oil painting and an article on picasso from the hotel. I offer heartfelt congratulations to her for having accepted a commission to make a sculpture, do a sketch, paint an oil painting and write an article on picasso for the hotel since it's a once in a lifetime opportunity. I've always admired the exquisite colors of oil paintings be it a portrait or landscape. Erika's palette consists of greens browns and blues while her former classmate who's also a painter paints from a palette consisting of whites oranges and reds. A palette, a set of paintbrushes and paints normally cost around seven hundred dollars altogether. If you happen to stay in the aforementioned hotel please remember the following as I work there: First before washing your clothes please remove coins and tissue from the pockets and put the dirty clothes in about two thirds of the wash tub. This will ensure your clothes to get evenly clean and the machine will less likely be out of order. Please wipe the seum with a towel after each use so as not to cause mould or mildew to grow in the drum. Second, don't set the air conditioner up to more than twenty five degrees celcius. Otherwise it won't blow cold air and will smell bad. Third after cleaning the toilet and the tables with detergent or sudsy water, rinse a cloth or handkerchief and wipe them again so as not to cause discoloration in the drum. Lastly do not nail or stick anything to the wall as the paint will peel. Finally have a wonderful time there!

My friend Tomio soaks up new words and grammar patterns very quickly. In the classes he soaks up everything the teacher says. His vocabulary is fairly large whereas his cousin has a very limited vocabulary. He tries to learn eleven new vocabulary items a day to expand his vocabulary. He has a vocabulary of around twenty thousand words which is pretty impressive. His cousin's husband has an active vocabulary of about eight thousand eight hundred words. Of course your passive vocabulary is much wider than your active vocabulary. What's the best way of learning new vocabulary ? What's the most ideal way of enriching your vocabulary ? For Jason, it is via reading a japanese novel over and over again until you can remember every part of the story. For others, it is through creating sentences  with new words in them and pronouncing them. Originally  yesterday I had lunch in an Italian restaurant but I realised I didn't like the menu. As I was leaving a waitress came up to me so I said "Thank you but I've changed my mind" A burly guy and a svelte girl also didn't like the menu so the guy said "Thank you. We're in the mood for a different cuisine today. We'll be back another time. Thank you for your hospitality. I work in Hotel JAP Tokyo. My cousin came to stay for a few nights as company for me while my colleagues are away. (When I'm in a hotel room I usually have the television on until I go to bed) My friend Rika has got a commission for a sculpture, a sketch, an oil painting and an article on picasso from the hotel. I offer heartfelt congratulations to her for having accepted a commission to make a sculpture, do a sketch, paint an oil painting and write an article on picasso for the hotel since it's a once in a lifetime opportunity. I've always admired the exquisite colors of oil paintings be it a portrait or landscape. Erika's palette consists of greens browns and blues while her former classmate who's also a painter paints from a palette consisting of whites oranges and reds. A palette, a set of paintbrushes and paints normally cost around seven hundred dollars altogether. If you happen to stay in the aforementioned hotel please remember the following as I work there: First before washing your clothes please remove coins and tissue from the pockets and put the dirty clothes in about two thirds of the wash tub. This will ensure your clothes to get evenly clean and the machine will less likely be out of order. Please wipe the seum with a towel after each use so as not to cause mould or mildew to grow in the drum. Second, don't set the air conditioner up to more than twenty five degrees celcius. Otherwise it won't blow cold air and will smell bad. Third after cleaning the toilet and the tables with detergent or sudsy water, rinse a cloth or handkerchief and wipe them again so as not to cause discoloration in the drum. Lastly do not nail or stick anything to the wall as the paint will peel. Finally have a wonderful time there!

項目六 - 取消旅程保障及項目七 - 提早結束旅程保障的不保項目
本公司不會保障由於以下而直接或間接引起的索償：
I. 政府規例或行動（就在本保險生效後首次發出黑色或紅色外遊警示則除外），或由於行程內任何安排行程的服務提供者或預訂行程的代理或旅行社在其已安排的行程中無法提供所預訂行程的任何部份（包括出錯、遺漏或不履行），以致出現任何形式的旅程延遲或更改。
III. 因任何受保人不願成行或其財政狀況所導致。
